intro: Leptotaenia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected leptotaenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
